I had the same issue with multiple sources. Being a minimalist, Instead of using negativo's repositories (nothing against them, I think they are great and convenient!) Here is what I did on Fedora 27 after installing all the normal development packages included in epel-release and so forth:

1. Compiled Video card drivers from source using NVIDIA-Linux-x86_64-390.48.run file provided by NVidia..

2. Compiled the Cuda using cuda_9.1.85_387.26_linux.run. as well as declined to install driver for GPU. patched using the three run files, cuda_9.1.85.1_linux.run cuda_9.1.85.2_linux.run cuda_9.1.85.3_linux.run.

3. Created two files within the /etc/profile.d/ directory:

touch /etc/profile.d/cuda.sh
echo "PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/cuda/bin" >> /etc/profile.d/cuda.sh
echo "export PATH" >> /etc/profile.d/cuda.sh
touch /etc/profile.d/cuda.csh
echo "set path = ( $path /usr/local/cuda/bin )" >> /etc/profile.d/cuda.csh

4. Installed gcc63 from package - More than likely other versions will function as well.

5. Created the following two symbolic links:

/usr/local/cuda/bin/gcc -> /usr/bin/gcc63
/usr/local/cuda/bin/g++ -> /usr/bin/g++63

6. Took the advice from "xd009642" Patch cuda/include/host_defines.h

echo` "#define _BITS_FLOATN_H" >> /usr/local/cuda/include/host_defines.h

This resolved all compiling issues with NVCC for me so far. I understand many gcc versions are not supported but it is likely that many will work as well.

body:
### I had the same issue with multiple sources. Being a minimalist, Instead of using negativo's repositories (**nothing against them, I think they are great and convenient!**) Here is what I did on Fedora 27 after installing all the normal development packages included in epel-release and so forth:

### 1. Compiled Video card drivers from source using **NVIDIA-Linux-x86_64-390.48.run** file provided by NVidia..
### 2. Compiled the Cuda using cuda_**9.1.85_387.26_linux.run**. as well as declined to install driver for GPU. patched using the three run files, _cuda_9.1.85.1_linux.run cuda_9.1.85.2_linux.run_ _cuda_9.1.85.3_linux.run_.

### 3. Created two files within the **/etc/profile.d/** directory:
```
touch /etc/profile.d/cuda.sh
echo "PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/cuda/bin" >> /etc/profile.d/cuda.sh
echo "export PATH" >> /etc/profile.d/cuda.sh
touch /etc/profile.d/cuda.csh
echo "set path = ( $path /usr/local/cuda/bin )" >> /etc/profile.d/cuda.csh
```
### 4. Installed gcc63 from package - More than likely other versions will function as well.
### 5. Created the following two symbolic links:
```
/usr/local/cuda/bin/gcc -> /usr/bin/gcc63
/usr/local/cuda/bin/g++ -> /usr/bin/g++63
```
### 6. Took the advice from "xd009642"  Patch cuda/include/host_defines.h
```
echo` "#define _BITS_FLOATN_H" >> /usr/local/cuda/include/host_defines.h
```
### This resolved all compiling issues with NVCC for me so far. I understand many gcc versions are not supported but it is likely that many will work as well.
